content: In an expository essay, specifically, what is the primary function of the topic sentence located in the introduction paragraph, which is typically composed of a main idea and an assertion, that serves as a roadmap for the subsequent sentences in the same paragraph?

In an expository essay, the primary function of the topic sentence in the introduction paragraph is to clearly present the main idea and establish the focus of the essay. This sentence serves as a roadmap for the reader by outlining the key points that will be explored and explained in the subsequent sentences and paragraphs. It sets the tone and direction for the entire essay, guiding the reader through the argument or explanation that will be developed. By doing so, it helps organize the content and ensures that the essay remains coherent and focused on its central theme.
